question: Which two countries are connected by the "Frejus Road Tunnel"?
explanation: Frejus Road Tunnel is a 12.87-kilometer road tunnel that connects Italy and France. This tunnel opened in 1980, runs under the Col du Frejus mountain of the Cottian Alps between France and Italy. It is one of the major trans-Alpine transport routes between France and Italy being used for 80% of the commercial road traffic.
